Element Properties¶

The Element Properties API allows to listen on element property changes. Listeners can be attached to properties of DOM Elements. The core will handle DOM Mutations and resize events and call listeners when specific properties changed.

Available Properties¶

"css.[value]"

A CSS value. The [value] is a CSS value from jQuery.

"offset.left", "offset.top"

Element offset (jQuery)

"position.left", "position.top"

Element position (jQuery)

"scroll.left", "scroll.top"

ScrollTop and ScrollLeft (jQuery)

"width", "height"

width/height (jQuery)

"width.inner", "height.inner"

width/height (jQuery)

"width.outer", "height.outer"

width/height (jQuery)

"width.outerWithMargin", "height.outerWithMargin"

width/height (jQuery)

JavaScript¶

Public API¶

blue.ElementProperty.on(element, property, handler)¶

Attach the handler to the property of the element.

Arguments:
  • element (Element) – DOM Element.
  • proptery (string) – The property (for details see above).
  • handler (function) – A handler. Will be called as handler(newVal, oldVal).
blue.ElementProperty.off(element, property, handler)¶

Remove a handler.

Arguments:
  • element (Element) – DOM Element.
  • proptery (string) – The property.
  • handler (function) – The handler.

Private functions (not for use from outside)¶

blue.ElementProperty.fire(element, property, newVal, oldVal)¶

Call all handlers related to the given parameters.

blue.ElementProperty.getProperty(element, property)¶

Get the property of the element.

blue.ElementProperty.check(element, property)¶

Check for changes for the given element and properties (it’s a list). Both parameters can be undefined, which will perform checks for all elements/properties.

blue.ElementProperty.start()¶

Start the engines.
